snippet: Judges at the International Criminal Court ordered Libyan authorities to surrender Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and send him to the court in The Hague “without further ado.”
abstract: Judges at the International Criminal Court order Libyan authorities to surrender Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and send him to the court in The Hague immediately; it is the second but most strongly worded order from the court, which seeks to try him on charges of crimes against humanity for his role in the violent suppression of the uprising that led to his father’s overthrow.
lead_paragraph: Judges at the International Criminal Court ordered Libyan authorities to surrender Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and send him to the court in The Hague “without further ado.”

headline.seo: Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi Ordered to Trial at Hague
headline.main: Libya: Court Demands Handover of Qaddafi Son for Trial at Hague
headline.print_headline: Libya: Court Demands Handover Of Qaddafi Son for Trial at Hague

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
